lexUnit.name: position.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: put or arrange in a particular position.

sentence.text: Position cake against the green parcel .
The artist calmly took a small mechanical device and positioned it against the side of her finger which wore a glittering pair of rings in emerald and diamond .
Position the rectangular cake at the back of the board .
During a horse show he positioned himself at the edge of the arena .
If you have the choice , position your cannon at the far ends of your line to allow yourself diagonal shots across the enemy line .

A key objective since Tencel was launched has been to position it at the top end of the market , working with the best mills , converters and manufacturers and attracting a premium price for the fibre .
Leaving manufacturing behind enabled Conran to concentrate on retailing and position his company at the vanguard of the high-street revolution .
Position smaller leaves at three and six o'clock , then continue in this way around the clockface until you have made a bed of leaves .
He had positioned himself in a narrow doorway , in the vain hope it would provide him with some shelter from the biting cold .
She folded napkins to look like coronets and gave the crystal glasses a final polish before positioning them in groups to the right of each place .
Keep positioning yourself in the correct line while turning your own centre-line towards the opponent .
Position the folds in the fabric which form below each pleat by running your fingers down the length of the curtain .
Research can help a company to position its product in the market .
Remember our earlier advice about positioning the tank in your house ( PFK March ) .
She positioned herself on a front bench , laid out her pastels and board , and began drawing under the eyes of the judge , who , be all accounts , turned a shade of puce .
Once I even positioned myself on a nearby wall in order to study his features more carefully .
He found it hard to remember whether you had to position yourself on the left or the right side .
Position the hat on the robot 's head and make decorative markings with the back of a knife .
Mr Attlee was careful to position himself with the majority view in Cabinet .
I have purposely positioned this photograph away from the conference photographs to avoid readers confusing it with views of the Institute Officers .
McGowan positioned himself between Jed and Creed .
It was important to position herself within easy reach of the doors before letting him see her , in case she had to bolt .
This dowel can rotate freely , which helps in positioning the blocks .
They pushed the trolley through , and positioned it , as the patient had requested , by an open window .
He positioned the arbalest , leaned over the wall and released the catch .
The lines are positioned by referring to the CE or balance point of the rig .
After the name has been entered the cursor will be positioned at column 20 on the same line and Age ? will be printed .
These graphics can then be enlarged or reduced and positioned anywhere on the page .
Leaving two of the men in the bows to receive the cargo , he positioned two more along the windward side deck .
As an inmate you are shut away in a jail without a name and escape is an option rarely considered with armed guards carefully positioned at the perimeter fence of some of the prisons .
Their summer holidays are spent in the caravan they have positioned in the yard
Thomas went out , came back a moment later with an object draped in blue velvet which he positioned carefully on a low table .
As we have already seen , if speech is to be recorded clearly it is best picked up by an extension microphone positioned close to the speaker .
You can achieve much softer and more interesting effects by using different types of light carefully positioned around a room .
